did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Alben Barkley Esch-Cummins Bill Correspondence on Microfilm,
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Selected correspondence on Railroad Legislation. Includes correspondence relative to the Transportation Act of 1920 (Esch-Cummins Act) and the Barkley-Howell Bill of 1924.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Alben William Barkley (November 24, 1877 April 30, 1956) was a lawyer and politician from Kentucky who served in both houses of Congress and as the 35th Vice President of the United States from 1949 to 1953.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Selected correspondence on Railroad Legislation. Includes correspondence relative to the Transportation Act of 1920 (Esch-Cummins Act) and the Barkley-Howell Bill of 1924. A negative copy is available upon request.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Alben Barkley Esch-Cummins Bill Correspondence on Microfilm #5160 mf. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.
